Claim.comment: Often providers agree to receive the benefits payable to reduce the near-term costs to the patient. The insurer may decline to pay the provider and choose to pay the subscriber instead.

Claim.definition: Type of Party to be reimbursed: subscriber, provider, other.

binding.description: A code for the party to be reimbursed.

Claim.definition: Reference to the individual or organization to whom any payment will be made.
Claim.comment: Not required if the payee is 'subscriber' or 'provider'.

Claim.definition: A reference to a referral resource.
Claim.comment: The referral resource which lists the date, practitioner, reason and other supporting information.

Claim.definition: Facility where the services were provided.
The members of the team who provided the products and services.
A number to uniquely identify care team entries.
Member of the team who provided the product or service.
The party who is billing and/or responsible for the claimed products or services.
Claim.comment: Responsible might not be required when there is only a single provider listed.

Claim.definition: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisciplinary team.
Claim.comment: Role might not be required when there is only a single provider listed.

binding.description: The role codes for the care team members.

Claim.definition: The qualification of the practitioner which is applicable for this service.

binding.description: Provider professional qualifications.

Claim.definition: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.
Claim.comment: Often there are multiple jurisdiction specific valuesets which are required.

Claim.definition: A number to uniquely identify supporting information entries.
The general class of the information supplied: information; exception; accident, employment; onset, etc.
Claim.comment: This may contain a category for the local bill type codes.

binding.description: The valuset used for additional information category codes.

Claim.definition: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient  for which care is sought.

binding.description: The valuset used for additional information codes.

Claim.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.
Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.
Claim.comment: Could be used to provide references to other resources, document. For example could contain a PDF in an Attachment of the Police Report for an Accident.

Claim.definition: Provides the reason in the situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.
Claim.comment: For example: the reason for the additional stay, or why a tooth is  missing.

binding.description: Reason codes for the missing teeth.

Claim.definition: Information about diagnoses relevant to the claim items.
A number to uniquely identify diagnosis entries.
Claim.comment: Diagnosis are presented in list order to their expected importance: primary, secondary, etc.

Claim.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

binding.description: Example ICD10 Diagnostic codes.

Claim.short: Timing or nature of the diagnosis
Claim.definition: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.
Claim.comment: For example: admitting, primary, secondary, discharge.

binding.description: The type of the diagnosis: admitting, principal, discharge.

Claim.definition: Indication of whether the diagnosis was present on admission to a facility.

binding.description: Present on admission.

Claim.definition: A package billing code or bundle code used to group products and services to a particular health condition (such as heart attack) which is based on a predetermined grouping code system.
Claim.comment: For example DRG (Diagnosis Related Group) or a bundled billing code. A patient may have a diagnosis of a Myocardial Infarction and a DRG for HeartAttack would be assigned. The Claim item (and possible subsequent claims) would refer to the DRG for those line items that were for services related to the heart attack event.

binding.description: The DRG codes associated with the diagnosis.

Claim.definition: Procedures performed on the patient relevant to the billing items with the claim.
A number to uniquely identify procedure entries.
When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.
Claim.comment: For example: primary, secondary.

binding.description: Example procedure type codes.

Claim.definition: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed.
The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.

binding.description: Example ICD10 Procedure codes.

Claim.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.
Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.
Claim.comment: All insurance coverages for the patient which may be applicable for reimbursement, of the products and services listed in the claim, are typically provided in the claim to allow insurers to confirm the ordering of the insurance coverages relative to local 'coordination of benefit' rules. One coverage (and only one) with 'focal=true' is to be used in the adjudication of this claim. Coverages appearing before the focal Coverage in the list, and where 'Coverage.subrogation=false', should provide a reference to the ClaimResponse containing the adjudication results of the prior claim.

Claim.definition: A number to uniquely identify insurance entries and provide a sequence of coverages to convey coordination of benefit order.

Claim.short: Coverage to be used for adjudication
Claim.definition: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for adjudication of this claim when set to true.
Claim.comment: A patient may (will) have multiple insurance policies which provide reimbursement for healthcare services and products. For example a person may also be covered by their spouse's policy and both appear in the list (and may be from the same insurer). This flag will be set to true for only one of the listed policies and that policy will be used for adjudicating this claim. Other claims would be created to request adjudication against the other listed policies.

Claim.definition: The business identifier to be used when the claim is sent for adjudication against this insurance policy.
Claim.comment: Only required in jurisdictions where insurers, rather than the provider, are required to send claims to  insurers that appear after them in the list. This element is not required when 'subrogation=true'.

Claim.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.
A business agreement number established between the provider and the insurer for special business processing purposes.
Reference numbers previously provided by the insurer to the provider to be quoted on subsequent claims containing services or products related to the prior authorization.
Claim.comment: This value is an alphanumeric string that may be provided over the phone, via text, via paper, or within a ClaimResponse resource and is not a FHIR Identifier.

Claim.definition: The result of the adjudication of the line items for the Coverage specified in this insurance.
Claim.comment: Must not be specified when 'focal=true' for this insurance.

Claim.definition: Details of an accident which resulted in injuries which required the products and services listed in the claim.
Date of an accident event  related to the products and services contained in the claim.
Claim.comment: The date of the accident has to precede the dates of the products and services but within a reasonable timeframe.

Claim.definition: The type or context of the accident event for the purposes of selection of potential insurance coverages and determination of coordination between insurers.

binding.description: Type of accident: work place, auto, etc.

Claim.definition: The physical location of the accident event.
A claim line. Either a simple  product or service or a 'group' of details which can each be a simple items or groups of sub-details.
A number to uniquely identify item entries.
CareTeam members related to this service or product.
Diagnosis applicable for this service or product.
Procedures applicable for this service or product.
Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information applicable for this service or product.
The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

binding.description: Codes for the revenue or cost centers supplying the service and/or products.

Claim.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.
Claim.comment: Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.

binding.description: Benefit categories such as: oral-basic, major, glasses.

Claim.short: Billing, service, product, or drug code
Claim.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
Claim.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

Claim.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
Claim.comment: For example in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or outside of office hours.

binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

Claim.short: Program the product or service is provided under
Claim.definition: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.
Claim.comment: For example: Neonatal program, child dental program or drug users recovery program.

binding.description: Program specific reason codes.

Claim.short: Date or dates of service or product delivery
Claim.definition: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

Claim.short: Place of service or where product was supplied
Claim.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

binding.description: Place of service: pharmacy, school, prison, etc.

Claim.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

Claim.short: Fee, charge or cost per item
Claim.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
Claim.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

Claim.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
Claim.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor  = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

Claim.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.
Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc.).
Claim.comment: For example: Providing a tooth code, allows an insurer to identify a provider performing a filling on a tooth that was previously removed.

binding.description: The code for the teeth, quadrant, sextant and arch.

Claim.definition: A region or surface of the bodySite, e.g. limb region or tooth surface(s).

binding.description: The code for the tooth surface and surface combinations.

Claim.short: Encounters related to this billed item
Claim.definition: The Encounters during which this Claim was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
Claim.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter.

Claim.definition: A claim detail line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of sub-details which are simple items.
A number to uniquely identify item entries.
The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

binding.description: Codes for the revenue or cost centers supplying the service and/or products.

Claim.comment: Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.

Claim.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.
The total value of the all the items in the claim.

ClaimResponse.short: Business Identifier for a claim response
ClaimResponse.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this claim response.
The status of the resource instance.
ClaimResponse.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

ClaimResponse.definition: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.
ClaimResponse.comment: This may contain the local bill type codes, for example the US UB-04 bill type code or the CMS bill type.

binding.description: The type or discipline-style of the claim.

ClaimResponse.definition: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.
ClaimResponse.comment: This may contain the local bill type codes, for example the US UB-04 bill type code or the CMS bill type.

binding.description: A more granular claim typecode.

ClaimResponse.definition: A code to indicate whether the nature of the request is: to request adjudication of products and services previously rendered; or requesting authorization and adjudication for provision in the future; or requesting the non-binding adjudication of the listed products and services which could be provided in the future.

binding.description: Claim, preauthorization, predetermination.

ClaimResponse.short: The recipient of the products and services
ClaimResponse.definition: The party to whom the professional services and/or products have been supplied or are being considered and for whom actual for facast reimbursement is sought.
The date this resource was created.
The party responsible for authorization, adjudication and reimbursement.
The provider which is responsible for the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.
ClaimResponse.comment: Typically this field would be 1..1 where this party is responsible for the claim but not necessarily professionally responsible for the provision of the individual products and services listed below.

ClaimResponse.definition: Original request resource reference.
The outcome of the claim, predetermination, or preauthorization processing.
ClaimResponse.comment: The resource may be used to indicate that: the request has been held (queued) for processing; that it has been processed and errors found (error); that no errors were found and that some of the adjudication has been undertaken (partial) or that all of the adjudication has been undertaken (complete).

binding.description: The result of the claim processing.

ClaimResponse.definition: A human readable description of the status of the adjudication.
Reference from the Insurer which is used in later communications which refers to this adjudication.
ClaimResponse.comment: This value is only present on preauthorization adjudications.

ClaimResponse.definition: The time frame during which this authorization is effective.

ClaimResponse.short: Party to be paid any benefits payable
ClaimResponse.definition: Type of Party to be reimbursed: subscriber, provider, other.

binding.description: A code for the party to be reimbursed.

ClaimResponse.definition: A claim line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of details which can also be a simple items or groups of sub-details.
A number to uniquely reference the claim item entries.
The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

If this item is a group then the values here are a summary of the adjudication of the detail items. If this item is a simple product or service then this is the result of the adjudication of this item.

A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that: the patient is responsible for in aggregate or pertaining to this item; amounts paid by other coverages; and, the benefit payable for this item.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example codes indicating: Co-Pay, deductible, eligible, benefit, tax, etc.

binding.description: The adjudication codes.

ClaimResponse.definition: A code supporting the understanding of the adjudication result and explaining variance from expected amount.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example may indicate that the funds for this benefit type have been exhausted.

binding.description: The adjudication reason codes.

ClaimResponse.definition: Monetary amount associated with the category.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example: amount submitted, eligible amount, co-payment, and benefit payable.

ClaimResponse.definition: A non-monetary value associated with the category. Mutually exclusive to the amount element above.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example: eligible percentage or co-payment percentage.

ClaimResponse.definition: A claim detail. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of sub-details which are simple items.
A number to uniquely reference the claim detail entry.
The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.
A sub-detail adjudication of a simple product or service.
A number to uniquely reference the claim sub-detail entry.
The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.
The first-tier service adjudications for payor added product or service lines.
Claim items which this service line is intended to replace.
The sequence number of the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.
The sequence number of the sub-details within the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.
The providers who are authorized for the services rendered to the patient.

ClaimResponse.short: Billing, service, product, or drug code
ClaimResponse.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
ClaimResponse.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

ClaimResponse.comment: For example in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or outside of office hours.

binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

ClaimResponse.short: Program the product or service is provided under
ClaimResponse.definition: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example: Neonatal program, child dental program or drug users recovery program.

binding.description: Program specific reason codes.

ClaimResponse.short: Date or dates of service or product delivery
ClaimResponse.definition: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

ClaimResponse.short: Place of service or where product was supplied
ClaimResponse.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

binding.description: Place of service: pharmacy, school, prison, etc.

ClaimResponse.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

ClaimResponse.short: Fee, charge or cost per item
ClaimResponse.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

ClaimResponse.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

ClaimResponse.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor  = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

ClaimResponse.definition: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc.).
ClaimResponse.comment: For example: Providing a tooth code allows an insurer to identify a provider performing a filling on a tooth that was previously removed.

binding.description: The code for the teeth, quadrant, sextant and arch.

ClaimResponse.definition: A region or surface of the bodySite, e.g. limb region or tooth surface(s).

binding.description: The code for the tooth surface and surface combinations.

ClaimResponse.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.
The second-tier service adjudications for payor added services.

ClaimResponse.short: Billing, service, product, or drug code
ClaimResponse.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
ClaimResponse.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

ClaimResponse.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or outside of office hours.

binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

ClaimResponse.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

ClaimResponse.short: Fee, charge or cost per item
ClaimResponse.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
ClaimResponse.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

ClaimResponse.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor  = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

ClaimResponse.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.
The third-tier service adjudications for payor added services.

ClaimResponse.short: Billing, service, product, or drug code
ClaimResponse.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
ClaimResponse.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

ClaimResponse.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or outside of office hours.

binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

ClaimResponse.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

ClaimResponse.short: Fee, charge or cost per item
ClaimResponse.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
ClaimResponse.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

ClaimResponse.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor  = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

ClaimResponse.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.
Categorized monetary totals for the adjudication.
ClaimResponse.comment: Totals for amounts submitted, co-pays, benefits payable etc.

ClaimResponse.definition: A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example codes indicating: Co-Pay, deductible, eligible, benefit, tax, etc.

binding.description: The adjudication codes.

ClaimResponse.definition: Monetary total amount associated with the category.
Payment details for the adjudication of the claim.
Whether this represents partial or complete payment of the benefits payable.

binding.description: The type (partial, complete) of the payment.

ClaimResponse.definition: Total amount of all adjustments to this payment included in this transaction which are not related to this claim's adjudication.
ClaimResponse.comment: Insurers will deduct amounts owing from the provider (adjustment), such as a prior overpayment, from the amount owing to the provider (benefits payable) when payment is made to the provider.

ClaimResponse.definition: Reason for the payment adjustment.

binding.description: Payment Adjustment reason codes.

ClaimResponse.definition: Estimated date the payment will be issued or the actual issue date of payment.
Benefits payable less any payment adjustment.
Issuer's unique identifier for the payment instrument.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example: EFT number or check number.

ClaimResponse.definition: A code, used only on a response to a preauthorization, to indicate whether the benefits payable have been reserved and for whom.
ClaimResponse.comment: Fund would be release by a future claim quoting the preAuthRef of this response. Examples of values include: provider, patient, none.

binding.description: For whom funds are to be reserved: (Patient, Provider, None).

ClaimResponse.definition: A code for the form to be used for printing the content.
ClaimResponse.comment: May be needed to identify specific jurisdictional forms.

binding.description: The forms codes.

ClaimResponse.definition: The actual form, by reference or inclusion, for printing the content or an EOB.
ClaimResponse.comment: Needed to permit insurers to include the actual form.

ClaimResponse.definition: A note that describes or explains adjudication results in a human readable form.
A number to uniquely identify a note entry.
The business purpose of the note text.

binding.description: The presentation types of notes.

ClaimResponse.definition: The explanation or description associated with the processing.
A code to define the language used in the text of the note.
ClaimResponse.comment: Only required if the language is different from the resource language.

binding.description: A human language.

ClaimResponse.definition: Request for additional supporting or authorizing information.
ClaimResponse.comment: For example: professional reports, documents, images, clinical resources, or accident reports.

ClaimResponse.definition: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.
ClaimResponse.comment: All insurance coverages for the patient which may be applicable for reimbursement, of the products and services listed in the claim, are typically provided in the claim to allow insurers to confirm the ordering of the insurance coverages relative to local 'coordination of benefit' rules. One coverage (and only one) with 'focal=true' is to be used in the adjudication of this claim. Coverages appearing before the focal Coverage in the list, and where 'subrogation=false', should provide a reference to the ClaimResponse containing the adjudication results of the prior claim.

ClaimResponse.definition: A number to uniquely identify insurance entries and provide a sequence of coverages to convey coordination of benefit order.

ClaimResponse.short: Coverage to be used for adjudication
ClaimResponse.definition: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for adjudication of this claim when set to true.
ClaimResponse.comment: A patient may (will) have multiple insurance policies which provide reimbursement for healthcare services and products. For example a person may also be covered by their spouse's policy and both appear in the list (and may be from the same insurer). This flag will be set to true for only one of the listed policies and that policy will be used for adjudicating this claim. Other claims would be created to request adjudication against the other listed policies.

ClaimResponse.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.
A business agreement number established between the provider and the insurer for special business processing purposes.
The result of the adjudication of the line items for the Coverage specified in this insurance.
ClaimResponse.comment: Must not be specified when 'focal=true' for this insurance.

ClaimResponse.definition: Errors encountered during the processing of the adjudication.
ClaimResponse.comment: If the request contains errors then an error element should be provided and no adjudication related sections (item, addItem, or payment) should be present.

ClaimResponse.definition: The sequence number of the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error occurs outside of the item structure.
The sequence number of the detail within the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error occurs outside of the item structure.
The sequence number of the sub-detail within the detail within the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error occurs outside of the item structure.
An error code, from a specified code system, which details why the claim could not be adjudicated.

binding.description: The adjudication error codes.

ClinicalImpression.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this clinical impression by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
ClinicalImpression.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

ClinicalImpression.definition: Identifies the workflow status of the assessment.
ClinicalImpression.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the code entered-in-error that marks the clinical impression as not currently valid.

binding.description: The workflow state of a clinical impression.

ClinicalImpression.definition: Captures the reason for the current state of the ClinicalImpression.
ClinicalImpression.comment: This is generally only used for "exception" statuses such as "not-done", "suspended" or "cancelled".  [distinct reason codes for different statuses can be enforced using invariants if they are universal bindings].

binding.description: Codes identifying the reason for the current state of a clinical impression.

ClinicalImpression.definition: Categorizes the type of clinical assessment performed.
ClinicalImpression.comment: This is present as a place-holder only and may be removed based on feedback/work group opinion.

binding.description: Identifies categories of clinical impressions.  This is a place-holder only.  It may be removed.

ClinicalImpression.definition: A summary of the context and/or cause of the assessment - why / where it was performed, and what patient events/status prompted it.
The patient or group of individuals assessed as part of this record.
The Encounter during which this ClinicalImpression was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
ClinicalImpression.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter.

ClinicalImpression.definition: The point in time or period over which the subject was assessed.
ClinicalImpression.comment: This SHOULD be accurate to at least the minute, though some assessments only have a known date.

ClinicalImpression.definition: Indicates when the documentation of the assessment was complete.
The clinician performing the assessment.

A reference to the last assessment that was conducted on this patient. Assessments are often/usually ongoing in nature; a care provider (practitioner or team) will make new assessments on an ongoing basis as new data arises or the patient's conditions changes.
ClinicalImpression.comment: It is always likely that multiple previous assessments exist for a patient. The point of quoting a previous assessment is that this assessment is relative to it (see resolved).

ClinicalImpression.definition: A list of the relevant problems/conditions for a patient.
ClinicalImpression.comment: e.g. The patient is a pregnant, has congestive heart failure, has an Adenocarcinoma, and is allergic to penicillin.

ClinicalImpression.short: One or more sets of investigations (signs, symptoms, etc.)
ClinicalImpression.definition: One or more sets of investigations (signs, symptoms, etc.). The actual grouping of investigations varies greatly depending on the type and context of the assessment. These investigations may include data generated during the assessment process, or data previously generated and recorded that is pertinent to the outcomes.

A name/code for the group ("set") of investigations. Typically, this will be something like "signs", "symptoms", "clinical", "diagnostic", but the list is not constrained, and others such groups such as (exposure|family|travel|nutritional) history may be used.

binding.description: A name/code for a set of investigations.

ClinicalImpression.definition: A record of a specific investigation that was undertaken.
ClinicalImpression.comment: Most investigations are observations of one kind or another but some other specific types of data collection resources can also be used.

ClinicalImpression.definition: Reference to a specific published clinical protocol that was followed during this assessment, and/or that provides evidence in support of the diagnosis.
A text summary of the investigations and the diagnosis.

ClinicalImpression.short: Possible or likely findings and diagnoses
ClinicalImpression.definition: Specific findings or diagnoses that were considered likely or relevant to ongoing treatment.
Specific text or code for finding or diagnosis, which may include ruled-out or resolved conditions.

binding.description: Identification of the Condition or diagnosis.

ClinicalImpression.definition: Specific reference for finding or diagnosis, which may include ruled-out or resolved conditions.
Which investigations support finding or diagnosis.
Estimate of likely outcome.

binding.description: Prognosis or outlook findings.

ClinicalImpression.definition: RiskAssessment expressing likely outcome.
Information supporting the clinical impression.
Commentary about the impression, typically recorded after the impression itself was made, though supplemental notes by the original author could also appear.
ClinicalImpression.comment: Don't use this element for content that should more properly appear as one of the specific elements of the impression.

CodeSystem.short: Canonical identifier for this code system, represented as a URI (globally unique) (Coding.system)
CodeSystem.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this code system is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the code system is stored on different servers. This is used in [Coding](datatypes.html#Coding).system.
CodeSystem.comment: Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred.  Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.  The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author.  Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).   In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

CodeSystem.short: Additional identifier for the code system (business identifier)
CodeSystem.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this code system when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
CodeSystem.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this code system outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.  Note that HL7 defines at least three identifiers for many of its code systems - the FHIR canonical URL, the OID and the V2 Table 0396 mnemonic code.

CodeSystem.short: Business version of the code system (Coding.version)
CodeSystem.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the code system author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. This is used in [Coding](datatypes.html#Coding).version.
CodeSystem.comment: There may be different code system instances that have the same identifier but different versions.  The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the code system with the format [url]|[version].

CodeSystem.short: Name for this code system (computer friendly)
CodeSystem.definition: A natural language name identifying the code system. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
CodeSystem.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

CodeSystem.short: Name for this code system (human friendly)
CodeSystem.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the code system.
CodeSystem.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

CodeSystem.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
CodeSystem.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the code system resource was created or revised.
CodeSystem.comment: Allows filtering of code systems that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

CodeSystem.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
CodeSystem.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this code system is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
CodeSystem.comment: Allows filtering of code systems that are appropriate for use versus not.

CodeSystem.short: Date last changed
CodeSystem.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the code system was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the code system changes.
CodeSystem.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the code system. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

CodeSystem.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
CodeSystem.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the code system.
CodeSystem.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the code system is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the code system. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the code system. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

CodeSystem.short: Contact details for the publisher
CodeSystem.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
CodeSystem.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

CodeSystem.short: Natural language description of the code system
CodeSystem.definition: A free text natural language description of the code system from a consumer's perspective.
CodeSystem.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the code system was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the code system as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the code system is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the code system was created).

CodeSystem.short: The context that the content is intended to support
CodeSystem.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate code system instances.
CodeSystem.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

CodeSystem.short: Intended jurisdiction for code system (if applicable)
CodeSystem.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the code system is intended to be used.
CodeSystem.comment: It may be possible for the code system to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

CodeSystem.short: Why this code system is defined
CodeSystem.definition: Explanation of why this code system is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
CodeSystem.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the code system. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is.  This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this code system.

CodeSystem.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
CodeSystem.definition: A copyright statement relating to the code system and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the code system.
CodeSystem.comment: ... Sometimes, the copyright differs between the code system and the codes that are included. The copyright statement should clearly differentiate between these when required.

CodeSystem.short: If code comparison is case sensitive
CodeSystem.definition: If code comparison is case sensitive when codes within this system are compared to each other.
CodeSystem.comment: If this value is missing, then it is not specified whether a code system is case sensitive or not. When the rule is not known, Postel's law should be followed: produce codes with the correct case, and accept codes in any case. This element is primarily provided to support validation software.

CodeSystem.short: Canonical reference to the value set with entire code system
CodeSystem.definition: Canonical reference to the value set that contains the entire code system.
CodeSystem.comment: The definition of the value set SHALL include all codes from this code system and only codes from this code system, and it SHALL be immutable.

CodeSystem.short: grouped-by | is-a | part-of | classified-with
CodeSystem.definition: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts as represented in this resource.
CodeSystem.comment: Note that other representations might have a different hierarchy or none at all, and represent the information using properties.

binding.description: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts in a code system.

CodeSystem.short: If code system defines a compositional grammar
CodeSystem.definition: The code system defines a compositional (post-coordination) grammar.
CodeSystem.comment: Note that the code system resource does not define what the compositional grammar is, only whether or not there is one.

CodeSystem.short: If definitions are not stable
CodeSystem.definition: This flag is used to signify that the code system does not commit to concept permanence across versions. If true, a version must be specified when referencing this code system.
CodeSystem.comment: Best practice is that code systems do not redefine concepts, or that if concepts are redefined, a new code system definition is created. But this is not always possible, so some code systems may be defined as 'versionNeeded'.  Most code systems occasionally refine the displays defined for concepts between versions. Contexts in which the concept display values are validated may require that the version be specified for some code systems irrespective of the value of this property.

CodeSystem.short: not-present | example | fragment | complete | supplement
CodeSystem.definition: The extent of the content of the code system (the concepts and codes it defines) are represented in this resource instance.

binding.description: The extent of the content of the code system (the concepts and codes it defines) are represented in a code system resource.

CodeSystem.short: Canonical URL of Code System this adds designations and properties to
CodeSystem.definition: The canonical URL of the code system that this code system supplement is adding designations and properties to.
CodeSystem.comment: The most common use of a code system supplement is to add additional language support.

CodeSystem.short: Total concepts in the code system
CodeSystem.definition: The total number of concepts defined by the code system. Where the code system has a compositional grammar, the basis of this count is defined by the system steward.
CodeSystem.comment: The count of concepts defined in this resource cannot be more than this value but may be less for several reasons - see the content element.

CodeSystem.short: Filter that can be used in a value set
CodeSystem.definition: A filter that can be used in a value set compose statement when selecting concepts using a filter.
CodeSystem.comment: Note that filters defined in code systems usually require custom code on the part of any terminology engine that will make them available for use in value set filters. For this reason, they are generally only seen in high value published terminologies.

CodeSystem.short: Code that identifies the filter
CodeSystem.definition: The code that identifies this filter when it is used as a filter in [ValueSet](valueset.html#).compose.include.filter.

CodeSystem.short: How or why the filter is used
CodeSystem.definition: A description of how or why the filter is used.

CodeSystem.short: Operators that can be used with filter
CodeSystem.definition: A list of operators that can be used with the filter.

binding.description: The kind of operation to perform as a part of a property based filter.

CodeSystem.short: What to use for the value
CodeSystem.definition: A description of what the value for the filter should be.

CodeSystem.short: Additional information supplied about each concept
CodeSystem.definition: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.

CodeSystem.short: Identifies the property on the concepts, and when referred to in operations
CodeSystem.definition: A code that is used to identify the property. The code is used internally (in CodeSystem.concept.property.code) and also externally, such as in property filters.

CodeSystem.short: Formal identifier for the property
CodeSystem.definition: Reference to the formal meaning of the property. One possible source of meaning is the [Concept Properties](codesystem-concept-properties.html) code system.

CodeSystem.short: Why the property is defined, and/or what it conveys
CodeSystem.definition: A description of the property- why it is defined, and how its value might be used.

CodeSystem.short: code | Coding | string | integer | boolean | dateTime | decimal
CodeSystem.definition: The type of the property value. Properties of type "code" contain a code defined by the code system (e.g. a reference to another defined concept).

binding.description: The type of a property value.

CodeSystem.short: Concepts in the code system
CodeSystem.definition: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meanings of the hierarchical relationships are.
CodeSystem.comment: If this is empty, it means that the code system resource does not represent the content of the code system.

CodeSystem.short: Code that identifies concept
CodeSystem.definition: A code - a text symbol - that uniquely identifies the concept within the code system.

CodeSystem.short: Text to display to the user
CodeSystem.definition: A human readable string that is the recommended default way to present this concept to a user.

CodeSystem.short: Formal definition
CodeSystem.definition: The formal definition of the concept. The code system resource does not make formal definitions required, because of the prevalence of legacy systems. However, they are highly recommended, as without them there is no formal meaning associated with the concept.

CodeSystem.short: Additional representations for the concept
CodeSystem.definition: Additional representations for the concept - other languages, aliases, specialized purposes, used for particular purposes, etc.
CodeSystem.comment: Concepts have both a ```display``` and an array of ```designation```. The display is equivalent to a special designation with an implied ```designation.use``` of "primary code" and a language equal to the [Resource Language](resource.html#language).

CodeSystem.short: Human language of the designation
CodeSystem.definition: The language this designation is defined for.
CodeSystem.comment: In the absence of a language, the resource language applies.

binding.description: A human language.

CodeSystem.short: Details how this designation would be used
CodeSystem.definition: A code that details how this designation would be used.
CodeSystem.comment: If no use is provided, the designation can be assumed to be suitable for general display to a human user.

binding.description: Details of how a designation would be used.

CodeSystem.short: The text value for this designation
CodeSystem.definition: The text value for this designation.

CodeSystem.short: Property value for the concept
CodeSystem.definition: A property value for this concept.

CodeSystem.short: Reference to CodeSystem.property.code
CodeSystem.definition: A code that is a reference to CodeSystem.property.code.

CodeSystem.short: Value of the property for this concept
CodeSystem.definition: The value of this property.

Communication.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this communication by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
Communication.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

Communication.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Communication.
The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Communication.
Communication.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.

Communication.definition: An order, proposal or plan fulfilled in whole or in part by this Communication.
Communication.comment: This must point to some sort of a 'Request' resource, such as CarePlan, CommunicationRequest, ServiceRequest, MedicationRequest, etc.

Communication.definition: Part of this action.
Prior communication that this communication is in response to.

Communication.short: preparation | in-progress | not-done | suspended | aborted | completed | entered-in-error
Communication.definition: The status of the transmission.
Communication.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the codes aborted and entered-in-error that mark the communication as not currently valid.

binding.description: The status of the communication.

Communication.definition: Captures the reason for the current state of the Communication.
Communication.comment: This is generally only used for "exception" statuses such as "not-done", "suspended" or "aborted". The reason for performing the event at all is captured in reasonCode, not here.

binding.description: Codes for the reason why a communication did not happen.

Communication.definition: The type of message conveyed such as alert, notification, reminder, instruction, etc.
Communication.comment: There may be multiple axes of categorization and one communication may serve multiple purposes.

binding.description: Codes for general categories of communications such as alerts, instructions, etc.

Communication.definition: Characterizes how quickly the planned or in progress communication must be addressed. Includes concepts such as stat, urgent, routine.
Communication.comment: Used to prioritize workflow (such as which communication to read first) when the communication is planned or in progress.

binding.description: Codes indicating the relative importance of a communication.

Communication.definition: A channel that was used for this communication (e.g. email, fax).

binding.description: Codes for communication mediums such as phone, fax, email, in person, etc.

Communication.definition: The patient or group that was the focus of this communication.
Description of the purpose/content, similar to a subject line in an email.
Communication.comment: Communication.topic.text can be used without any codings.

binding.description: Codes describing the purpose or content of the communication.

Communication.short: Resources that pertain to this communication
Communication.definition: Other resources that pertain to this communication and to which this communication should be associated.
Communication.comment: Don't use Communication.about element when a more specific element exists, such as basedOn or reasonReference.

Communication.definition: The Encounter during which this Communication was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
Communication.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter.

Communication.definition: The time when this communication was sent.
The time when this communication arrived at the destination.

The entity (e.g. person, organization, clinical information system, care team or device) which was the target of the communication. If receipts need to be tracked by an individual, a separate resource instance will need to be created for each recipient.  Multiple recipient communications are intended where either receipts are not tracked (e.g. a mass mail-out) or a receipt is captured in aggregate (all emails confirmed received by a particular time).
The entity (e.g. person, organization, clinical information system, or device) which was the source of the communication.
The reason or justification for the communication.
Communication.comment: Textual reasons can be captured using reasonCode.text.

binding.description: Codes for describing reasons for the occurrence of a communication.

Communication.definition: Indicates another resource whose existence justifies this communication.
Text, attachment(s), or resource(s) that was communicated to the recipient.
A communicated content (or for multi-part communications, one portion of the communication).
Additional notes or commentary about the communication by the sender, receiver or other interested parties.

CommunicationRequest.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this communication request by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
CommunicationRequest.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

CommunicationRequest.definition: A plan or proposal that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this request.
Completed or terminated request(s) whose function is taken by this new request.
CommunicationRequest.comment: The replacement could be because the initial request was immediately rejected (due to an issue) or because the previous request was completed, but the need for the action described by the request remains ongoing.

CommunicationRequest.short: Composite request this is part of
CommunicationRequest.definition: A shared identifier common to all requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the identifier of the requisition, prescription or similar form.
CommunicationRequest.comment: Requests are linked either by a "basedOn" relationship (i.e. one request is fulfilling another) or by having a common requisition.  Requests that are part of the same requisition are generally treated independently from the perspective of changing their state or maintaining them after initial creation.

CommunicationRequest.short: draft | active | suspended | cancelled | completed | entered-in-error | unknown
CommunicationRequest.definition: The status of the proposal or order.

binding.description: The status of the communication request.

CommunicationRequest.definition: Captures the reason for the current state of the CommunicationRequest.
CommunicationRequest.comment: This is generally only used for "exception" statuses such as "suspended" or "cancelled".  The reason why the CommunicationRequest was created at all is captured in reasonCode, not here.  [distinct reason codes for different statuses can be enforced using invariants if they are universal bindings].

binding.description: Codes identifying the reason for the current state of a request.

CommunicationRequest.definition: The type of message to be sent such as alert, notification, reminder, instruction, etc.
CommunicationRequest.comment: There may be multiple axes of categorization and one communication request may serve multiple purposes.

binding.description: Codes for general categories of communications such as alerts, instruction, etc.

CommunicationRequest.definition: Characterizes how quickly the proposed act must be initiated. Includes concepts such as stat, urgent, routine.

binding.description: Codes indicating the relative importance of a communication request.

CommunicationRequest.short: True if request is prohibiting action
CommunicationRequest.definition: If true indicates that the CommunicationRequest is asking for the specified action to *not* occur.
CommunicationRequest.comment: The attributes provided with the request qualify what is not to be done.

CommunicationRequest.definition: A channel that was used for this communication (e.g. email, fax).

binding.description: Codes for communication mediums such as phone, fax, email, in person, etc.

CommunicationRequest.definition: The patient or group that is the focus of this communication request.

CommunicationRequest.short: Resources that pertain to this communication request
CommunicationRequest.definition: Other resources that pertain to this communication request and to which this communication request should be associated.
CommunicationRequest.comment: Don't use CommunicationRequest.about element when a more specific element exists, such as basedOn, reasonReference, or replaces.

CommunicationRequest.definition: The Encounter during which this CommunicationRequest was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
CommunicationRequest.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter.

CommunicationRequest.definition: Text, attachment(s), or resource(s) to be communicated to the recipient.
The communicated content (or for multi-part communications, one portion of the communication).
The time when this communication is to occur.

CommunicationRequest.short: When request transitioned to being actionable
CommunicationRequest.definition: For draft requests, indicates the date of initial creation.  For requests with other statuses, indicates the date of activation.
The device, individual, or organization who initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.
The entity (e.g. person, organization, clinical information system, device, group, or care team) which is the intended target of the communication.
The entity (e.g. person, organization, clinical information system, or device) which is to be the source of the communication.
Describes why the request is being made in coded or textual form.
CommunicationRequest.comment: Textual reasons can be captured using reasonCode.text.

binding.description: Codes for describing reasons for the occurrence of a communication.

CommunicationRequest.definition: Indicates another resource whose existence justifies this request.
Comments made about the request by the requester, sender, recipient, subject or other participants.

CompartmentDefinition.short: Canonical identifier for this compartment definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
CompartmentDefinition.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this compartment definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this compartment definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the compartment definition is stored on different servers.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred.  Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.  The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author.  Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).   In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

CompartmentDefinition.short: Business version of the compartment definition
CompartmentDefinition.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the compartment definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the compartment definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: There may be different compartment definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions.  The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the compartment definition with the format [url]|[version].

CompartmentDefinition.short: Name for this compartment definition (computer friendly)
CompartmentDefinition.definition: A natural language name identifying the compartment definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.This is often the same as the code for the parameter, but does not need to be.

CompartmentDefinition.definition: The status of this compartment definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: Allows filtering of compartment definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

CompartmentDefinition.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
CompartmentDefinition.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this compartment definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: Allows filtering of compartment definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

CompartmentDefinition.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the compartment definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the compartment definition changes.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the compartment definition. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

CompartmentDefinition.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
CompartmentDefinition.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the compartment definition.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the compartment definition is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the compartment definition. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the compartment definition. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

CompartmentDefinition.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

CompartmentDefinition.short: Natural language description of the compartment definition
CompartmentDefinition.definition: A free text natural language description of the compartment definition from a consumer's perspective.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the compartment definition was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the compartment definition as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the compartment definition is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the compartment definition was created).

CompartmentDefinition.short: The context that the content is intended to support
CompartmentDefinition.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate compartment definition instances.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

CompartmentDefinition.short: Why this compartment definition is defined
CompartmentDefinition.definition: Explanation of why this compartment definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the compartment definition. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is.  This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this compartment definition.
Only the specification can define the compartments that can exist. Servers can choose to support them.

binding.description: Which type a compartment definition describes.

CompartmentDefinition.short: Whether the search syntax is supported
CompartmentDefinition.definition: Whether the search syntax is supported,.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: Servers may define and use compartments to manage logical access without implementing the compartment related syntax.

CompartmentDefinition.short: How a resource is related to the compartment
CompartmentDefinition.definition: Information about how a resource is related to the compartment.
The name of a resource supported by the server.

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

CompartmentDefinition.short: Search Parameter Name, or chained parameters
CompartmentDefinition.definition: The name of a search parameter that represents the link to the compartment. More than one may be listed because a resource may be linked to a compartment in more than one way,.
CompartmentDefinition.comment: If no search parameters are listed, then the resource is not linked to the compartment.

CompartmentDefinition.short: Additional documentation about the resource and compartment
CompartmentDefinition.definition: Additional documentation about the resource and compartment.

Composition.definition: A version-independent identifier for the Composition. This identifier stays constant as the composition is changed over time.
Composition.comment: Similar to ClinicalDocument/setId in CDA. See discussion in resource definition for how these relate.

Composition.definition: The workflow/clinical status of this composition. The status is a marker for the clinical standing of the document.
Composition.comment: If a composition is marked as withdrawn, the compositions/documents in the series, or data from the composition or document series, should never be displayed to a user without being clearly marked as untrustworthy. The flag "entered-in-error" is why this element is labeled as a modifier of other elements.     Some reporting work flows require that the original narrative of a final document never be altered; instead, only new narrative can be added. The composition resource has no explicit status for explicitly noting whether this business rule is in effect. This would be handled by an extension if required.

binding.description: The workflow/clinical status of the composition.

Composition.definition: Specifies the particular kind of composition (e.g. History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Progress Note). This usually equates to the purpose of making the composition.
Composition.comment: For Composition type, LOINC is ubiquitous and strongly endorsed by HL7. Most implementation guides will require a specific LOINC code, or use LOINC as an extensible binding.

binding.description: Type of a composition.

Composition.definition: A categorization for the type of the composition - helps for indexing and searching. This may be implied by or derived from the code specified in the Composition Type.
Composition.comment: This is a metadata field from [XDS/MHD](http://wiki.ihe.net/index.php?title=Mobile_access_to_Health_Documents_(MHD)).

binding.description: High-level kind of a clinical document at a macro level.

Composition.short: Who and/or what the composition is about
Composition.definition: Who or what the composition is about. The composition can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (e.g. a machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of livestock, or a set of patients that share a common exposure).
Composition.comment: For clinical documents, this is usually the patient.

Composition.definition: Describes the clinical encounter or type of care this documentation is associated with.
The composition editing time, when the composition was last logically changed by the author.
Composition.comment: The Last Modified Date on the composition may be after the date of the document was attested without being changed.

Composition.short: Who and/or what authored the composition
Composition.definition: Identifies who is responsible for the information in the composition, not necessarily who typed it in.
Official human-readable label for the composition.
Composition.comment: For many compositions, the title is the same as the text or a display name of Composition.type (e.g. a "consultation" or "progress note"). Note that CDA does not make title mandatory, but there are no known cases where it is useful for title to be omitted, so it is mandatory here. Feedback on this requirement is welcome during the trial use period.

Composition.definition: The code specifying the level of confidentiality of the Composition.
Composition.comment: The exact use of this element, and enforcement and issues related to highly sensitive documents are out of scope for the base specification, and delegated to implementation profiles (see security section).  This element is labeled as a modifier because highly confidential documents must not be treated as if they are not.

binding.description: Codes specifying the level of confidentiality of the composition.

Composition.definition: A participant who has attested to the accuracy of the composition/document.
Composition.comment: Only list each attester once.

Composition.definition: The type of attestation the authenticator offers.

binding.description: The way in which a person authenticated a composition.

Composition.definition: When the composition was attested by the party.
Who attested the composition in the specified way.
Identifies the organization or group who is responsible for ongoing maintenance of and access to the composition/document information.
Composition.comment: This is useful when documents are derived from a composition - provides guidance for how to get the latest version of the document. This is optional because this is sometimes not known by the authoring system, and can be inferred by context. However, it is important that this information be known when working with a derived document, so providing a custodian is encouraged.

Composition.definition: Relationships that this composition has with other compositions or documents that already exist.
Composition.comment: A document is a version specific composition.
