Endpoint.comment: For rest-hook, and websocket, the end-point must be an http: or https: URL; for email, a mailto: url, for sms, a tel: url, and for message the endpoint can be in any form of url the server understands (usually, http: or mllp:). The URI is allowed to be relative; in which case, it is relative to the server end-point (since there may be more than one, clients should avoid using relative URIs)  This address will be to the service base, without any parameters, or sub-services or resources tacked on.  E.g. for a WADO-RS endpoint, the url should be "https://pacs.hospital.org/wado-rs"  and not "https://pacs.hospital.org/wado-rs/studies/1.2.250.1.59.40211.12345678.678910/series/1.2.250.1.59.40211.789001276.14556172.67789/instances/...".

Endpoint.short: Usage depends on the channel type
Endpoint.definition: Additional headers / information to send as part of the notification.
Endpoint.comment: Exactly what these mean depends on the channel type. The can convey additional information to the recipient and/or meet security requirements.

EnrollmentRequest.definition: The status of the resource instance.
EnrollmentRequest.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the request as not currently valid.

binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

EnrollmentRequest.definition: The date when this resource was created.
The Insurer who is target  of the request.
The practitioner who is responsible for the services rendered to the patient.
Reference to the program or plan identification, underwriter or payor.

EnrollmentResponse.definition: The status of the resource instance.
EnrollmentResponse.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the response as not currently valid.

binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.
The outcome of the processing.

EnrollmentResponse.definition: A description of the status of the adjudication.
The date when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.
The Insurer who produced this adjudicated response.
The practitioner who is responsible for the services rendered to the patient.

EpisodeOfCare.short: Business Identifier(s) relevant for this EpisodeOfCare
EpisodeOfCare.definition: The EpisodeOfCare may be known by different identifiers for different contexts of use, such as when an external agency is tracking the Episode for funding purposes.

EpisodeOfCare.short: planned | waitlist | active | onhold | finished | cancelled | entered-in-error
EpisodeOfCare.definition: planned | waitlist | active | onhold | finished | cancelled.
EpisodeOfCare.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the episode as not currently valid.

binding.description: The status of the episode of care.

EpisodeOfCare.short: Past list of status codes (the current status may be included to cover the start date of the status)
EpisodeOfCare.definition: The history of statuses that the EpisodeOfCare has been through (without requiring processing the history of the resource).

EpisodeOfCare.short: planned | waitlist | active | onhold | finished | cancelled | entered-in-error
EpisodeOfCare.definition: planned | waitlist | active | onhold | finished | cancelled.

binding.description: The status of the episode of care.

EpisodeOfCare.short: Duration the EpisodeOfCare was in the specified status
EpisodeOfCare.definition: The period during this EpisodeOfCare that the specific status applied.

EpisodeOfCare.short: Type/class  - e.g. specialist referral, disease management
EpisodeOfCare.definition: A classification of the type of episode of care; e.g. specialist referral, disease management, type of funded care.
EpisodeOfCare.comment: The type can be very important in processing as this could be used in determining if the EpisodeOfCare is relevant to specific government reporting, or other types of classifications.

binding.description: The type of the episode of care.

EpisodeOfCare.short: The list of diagnosis relevant to this episode of care
EpisodeOfCare.definition: The list of diagnosis relevant to this episode of care.

EpisodeOfCare.short: Conditions/problems/diagnoses this episode of care is for
EpisodeOfCare.definition: A list of conditions/problems/diagnoses that this episode of care is intended to be providing care for.

EpisodeOfCare.short: Role that this diagnosis has within the episode of care (e.g. admission, billing, discharge )
EpisodeOfCare.definition: Role that this diagnosis has within the episode of care (e.g. admission, billing, discharge ).

binding.description: The type of diagnosis this condition represents.

EpisodeOfCare.short: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type)
EpisodeOfCare.definition: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type).

EpisodeOfCare.short: The patient who is the focus of this episode of care
EpisodeOfCare.definition: The patient who is the focus of this episode of care.
The organization that has assumed the specific responsibilities for the specified duration.
The interval during which the managing organization assumes the defined responsibility.
Referral Request(s) that are fulfilled by this EpisodeOfCare, incoming referrals.

EpisodeOfCare.short: Care manager/care coordinator for the patient
EpisodeOfCare.definition: The practitioner that is the care manager/care coordinator for this patient.

EpisodeOfCare.short: Other practitioners facilitating this episode of care
EpisodeOfCare.definition: The list of practitioners that may be facilitating this episode of care for specific purposes.

EpisodeOfCare.short: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this EpisodeOfCare
EpisodeOfCare.definition: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this EpisodeOfCare.
EpisodeOfCare.comment: The billing system may choose to allocate billable items associated with the EpisodeOfCare to different referenced Accounts based on internal business rules.

EventDefinition.short: Canonical identifier for this event definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
EventDefinition.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this event definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this event definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the event definition is stored on different servers.
EventDefinition.comment: Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred.  Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.  The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author.  Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).   In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

EventDefinition.short: Additional identifier for the event definition
EventDefinition.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this event definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
EventDefinition.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this event definition outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.

EventDefinition.short: Business version of the event definition
EventDefinition.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the event definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the event definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
EventDefinition.comment: There may be different event definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions.  The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the event definition with the format [url]|[version].

EventDefinition.short: Name for this event definition (computer friendly)
EventDefinition.definition: A natural language name identifying the event definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
EventDefinition.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

EventDefinition.short: Name for this event definition (human friendly)
EventDefinition.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the event definition.
EventDefinition.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

EventDefinition.short: Subordinate title of the event definition
EventDefinition.definition: An explanatory or alternate title for the event definition giving additional information about its content.

EventDefinition.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
EventDefinition.definition: The status of this event definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
EventDefinition.comment: Allows filtering of event definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

EventDefinition.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
EventDefinition.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this event definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
EventDefinition.comment: Allows filtering of event definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

EventDefinition.short: Type of individual the event definition is focused on
EventDefinition.definition: A code or group definition that describes the intended subject of the event definition.

binding.description: The possible types of subjects for an event (E.g. Patient, Practitioner, Organization, Location, etc.).

EventDefinition.short: Date last changed
EventDefinition.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the event definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the event definition changes.
EventDefinition.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the event definition. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

EventDefinition.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
EventDefinition.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the event definition.
EventDefinition.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the event definition is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the event definition. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the event definition. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

EventDefinition.short: Contact details for the publisher
EventDefinition.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
EventDefinition.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

EventDefinition.short: Natural language description of the event definition
EventDefinition.definition: A free text natural language description of the event definition from a consumer's perspective.
EventDefinition.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the event definition was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the event definition as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the event definition is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the event definition was created).

EventDefinition.short: The context that the content is intended to support
EventDefinition.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate event definition instances.
EventDefinition.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

EventDefinition.short: Intended jurisdiction for event definition (if applicable)
EventDefinition.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the event definition is intended to be used.
EventDefinition.comment: It may be possible for the event definition to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

EventDefinition.short: Why this event definition is defined
EventDefinition.definition: Explanation of why this event definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
EventDefinition.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the event definition. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is.  This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this event definition.

EventDefinition.short: Describes the clinical usage of the event definition
EventDefinition.definition: A detailed description of how the event definition is used from a clinical perspective.

EventDefinition.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
EventDefinition.definition: A copyright statement relating to the event definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the event definition.

EventDefinition.short: When the event definition was approved by publisher
EventDefinition.definition: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.
EventDefinition.comment: The 'date' element may be more recent than the approval date because of minor changes or editorial corrections.

EventDefinition.short: When the event definition was last reviewed
EventDefinition.definition: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.
EventDefinition.comment: If specified, this date follows the original approval date.

EventDefinition.short: When the event definition is expected to be used
EventDefinition.definition: The period during which the event definition content was or is planned to be in active use.
EventDefinition.comment: The effective period for a event definition  determines when the content is applicable for usage and is independent of publication and review dates. For example, a measure intended to be used for the year 2016 might be published in 2015.

EventDefinition.short: E.g. Education, Treatment, Assessment, etc.
EventDefinition.definition: Descriptive topics related to the module. Topics provide a high-level categorization of the module that can be useful for filtering and searching.

binding.description: High-level categorization of the definition, used for searching, sorting, and filtering.

EventDefinition.short: Who authored the content
EventDefinition.definition: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

EventDefinition.short: Who edited the content
EventDefinition.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

EventDefinition.short: Who reviewed the content
EventDefinition.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

EventDefinition.short: Who endorsed the content
EventDefinition.definition: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

EventDefinition.short: Additional documentation, citations, etc.
EventDefinition.definition: Related resources such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.
EventDefinition.comment: Each related resource is either an attachment, or a reference to another resource, but not both.

EventDefinition.short: "when" the event occurs (multiple = 'or')
EventDefinition.definition: The trigger element defines when the event occurs. If more than one trigger condition is specified, the event fires whenever any one of the trigger conditions is met.

ExampleScenario.short: Canonical identifier for this example scenario, represented as a URI (globally unique)
ExampleScenario.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this example scenario when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this example scenario is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the example scenario is stored on different servers.
ExampleScenario.comment: Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred.  Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.  The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author.  Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).   In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

ExampleScenario.short: Additional identifier for the example scenario
ExampleScenario.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this example scenario when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
ExampleScenario.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this example scenario outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.

ExampleScenario.short: Business version of the example scenario
ExampleScenario.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the example scenario when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the example scenario author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
ExampleScenario.comment: There may be different example scenario instances that have the same identifier but different versions.  The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the example scenario with the format [url]|[version].

ExampleScenario.short: Name for this example scenario (computer friendly)
ExampleScenario.definition: A natural language name identifying the example scenario. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
ExampleScenario.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

ExampleScenario.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
ExampleScenario.definition: The status of this example scenario. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
ExampleScenario.comment: Allows filtering of example scenarios that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

ExampleScenario.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
ExampleScenario.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this example scenario is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
ExampleScenario.comment: Allows filtering of example scenarios that are appropriate for use versus not.

ExampleScenario.short: Date last changed
ExampleScenario.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the example scenario was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the example scenario changes. (e.g. the 'content logical definition').
ExampleScenario.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the example scenario. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

ExampleScenario.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
ExampleScenario.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the example scenario.
ExampleScenario.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the example scenario is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the example scenario. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the example scenario. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

ExampleScenario.short: Contact details for the publisher
ExampleScenario.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
ExampleScenario.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

ExampleScenario.short: The context that the content is intended to support
ExampleScenario.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate example scenario instances.
ExampleScenario.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

ExampleScenario.short: Intended jurisdiction for example scenario (if applicable)
ExampleScenario.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the example scenario is intended to be used.
ExampleScenario.comment: It may be possible for the example scenario to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

ExampleScenario.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
ExampleScenario.definition: A copyright statement relating to the example scenario and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the example scenario.
ExampleScenario.comment: nullFrequently, the copyright differs between the value set and the codes that are included. The copyright statement should clearly differentiate between these when required.

ExampleScenario.short: The purpose of the example, e.g. to illustrate a scenario
ExampleScenario.definition: What the example scenario resource is created for. This should not be used to show the business purpose of the scenario itself, but the purpose of documenting a scenario.
ExampleScenario.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the example scenario. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is.  This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this example scenario.

ExampleScenario.short: Actor participating in the resource
ExampleScenario.definition: Actor participating in the resource.

ExampleScenario.short: ID or acronym of the actor
ExampleScenario.definition: ID or acronym of actor.
ExampleScenario.comment: should this be called ID or acronym?

ExampleScenario.short: person | entity
ExampleScenario.definition: The type of actor - person or system.

binding.description: The type of actor - system or human.

ExampleScenario.short: The name of the actor as shown in the page
ExampleScenario.definition: The name of the actor as shown in the page.

ExampleScenario.short: The description of the actor
ExampleScenario.definition: The description of the actor.

ExampleScenario.short: Each resource and each version that is present in the workflow

ExampleScenario.definition: Indicates an alternative step that can be taken instead of the operations on the base step in exceptional/atypical circumstances.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this explanation of benefit.
The status of the resource instance.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The category of claim, e.g. oral, pharmacy, vision, institutional, professional.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: The majority of jurisdictions use: oral, pharmacy, vision, professional and institutional, or variants on those terms, as the general styles of claims. The valueset is extensible to accommodate other jurisdictional requirements.

binding.description: The type or discipline-style of the claim.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: This may contain the local bill type codes such as the US UB-04 bill type code.

binding.description: A more granular claim typecode.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A code to indicate whether the nature of the request is: to request adjudication of products and services previously rendered; or requesting authorization and adjudication for provision in the future; or requesting the non-binding adjudication of the listed products and services which could be provided in the future.

binding.description: Complete, proposed, exploratory, other.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: The recipient of the products and services
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The party to whom the professional services and/or products have been supplied or are being considered and for whom actual for forecast reimbursement is sought.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: Relevant time frame for the claim
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The period for which charges are being submitted.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Typically this would be today or in the past for a claim, and today or in the future for preauthorizations and prodeterminations. Typically line item dates of service should fall within the billing period if one is specified.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The date this resource was created.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: This field is independent of the date of creation of the resource as it may reflect the creation date of a source document prior to digitization. Typically for claims all services must be completed as of this date.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Individual who created the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.
The party responsible for authorization, adjudication and reimbursement.
The provider which is responsible for the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Typically this field would be 1..1 where this party is responsible for the claim but not necessarily professionally responsible for the provision of the individual products and services listed below.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The provider-required urgency of processing the request. Typical values include: stat, routine deferred.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: If a claim processor is unable to complete the processing as per the priority then they should generate and error and not process the request.

binding.description: The timeliness with which processing is required: stat, normal, deferred.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A code to indicate whether and for whom funds are to be reserved for future claims.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: This field is only used for preauthorizations.

binding.description: For whom funds are to be reserved: (Patient, Provider, None).

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A code, used only on a response to a preauthorization, to indicate whether the benefits payable have been reserved and for whom.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Fund would be release by a future claim quoting the preAuthRef of this response. Examples of values include: provider, patient, none.

binding.description: For whom funds are to be reserved: (Patient, Provider, None).

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior submissions or claims for related services or for the same event.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example,  for the original treatment and follow-up exams.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Reference to a related claim.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: How the reference claim is related
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A code to convey how the claims are related.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example, prior claim or umbrella.

binding.description: Relationship of this claim to a related Claim.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: An alternate organizational reference to the case or file to which this particular claim pertains.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example, Property/Casualty insurer claim number or Workers Compensation case number.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy, device or vision products.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: Original prescription if superceded by fulfiller
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Original prescription which has been superseded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example, a physician may prescribe a medication which the pharmacy determines is contraindicated, or for which the patient has an intolerance, and therefor issues a new prescription for an alternate medication which has the same therapeutic intent. The prescription from the pharmacy becomes the 'prescription' and that from the physician becomes the 'original prescription'.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The party to be reimbursed for cost of the products and services according to the terms of the policy.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Often providers agree to receive the benefits payable to reduce the near-term costs to the patient. The insurer may decline to pay the provider and may choose to pay the subscriber instead.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Type of Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.

binding.description: A code for the party to be reimbursed.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Reference to the individual or organization to whom any payment will be made.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Not required if the payee is 'subscriber' or 'provider'.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A reference to a referral resource.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: The referral resource which lists the date, practitioner, reason and other supporting information.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Facility where the services were provided.
The business identifier for the instance of the adjudication request: claim predetermination or preauthorization.
The business identifier for the instance of the adjudication response: claim, predetermination or preauthorization response.
The outcome of the claim, predetermination, or preauthorization processing.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: The resource may be used to indicate that: the request has been held (queued) for processing; that it has been processed and errors found (error); that no errors were found and that some of the adjudication has been undertaken (partial) or that all of the adjudication has been undertaken (complete).

binding.description: The result of the claim processing.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A human readable description of the status of the adjudication.
Reference from the Insurer which is used in later communications which refers to this adjudication.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: This value is only present on preauthorization adjudications.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The timeframe during which the supplied preauthorization reference may be quoted on claims to obtain the adjudication as provided.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: This value is only present on preauthorization adjudications.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The members of the team who provided the products and services.
A number to uniquely identify care team entries.
Member of the team who provided the product or service.
The party who is billing and/or responsible for the claimed products or services.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Responsible might not be required when there is only a single provider listed.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisciplinary team.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Role might not be required when there is only a single provider listed.

binding.description: The role codes for the care team members.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The qualification of the practitioner which is applicable for this service.

binding.description: Provider professional qualifications.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Often there are multiple jurisdiction specific valuesets which are required.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A number to uniquely identify supporting information entries.
The general class of the information supplied: information; exception; accident, employment; onset, etc.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: This may contain a category for the local bill type codes.

binding.description: The valuset used for additional information category codes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient  for which care is sought.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: This may contain the local bill type codes such as the US UB-04 bill type code.

binding.description: The valuset used for additional information codes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.
Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Could be used to provide references to other resources, document. For example, could contain a PDF in an Attachment of the Police Report for an Accident.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Provides the reason in the situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example: the reason for the additional stay, or why a tooth is  missing.

binding.description: Reason codes for the missing teeth.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Information about diagnoses relevant to the claim items.
A number to uniquely identify diagnosis entries.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Diagnosis are presented in list order to their expected importance: primary, secondary, etc.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

binding.description: ICD10 Diagnostic codes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: Timing or nature of the diagnosis
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example: admitting, primary, secondary, discharge.

binding.description: The type of the diagnosis: admitting, principal, discharge.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Indication of whether the diagnosis was present on admission to a facility.

binding.description: Present on admission.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A package billing code or bundle code used to group products and services to a particular health condition (such as heart attack) which is based on a predetermined grouping code system.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example, DRG (Diagnosis Related Group) or a bundled billing code. A patient may have a diagnosis of a Myocardio-infarction and a DRG for HeartAttack would assigned. The Claim item (and possible subsequent claims) would refer to the DRG for those line items that were for services related to the heart attack event.

binding.description: The DRG codes associated with the diagnosis.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Procedures performed on the patient relevant to the billing items with the claim.
A number to uniquely identify procedure entries.
When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.

binding.description: Example procedure type codes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed.
The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.

binding.description: ICD10 Procedure codes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.
This indicates the relative order of a series of EOBs related to different coverages for the same suite of services.
Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: All insurance coverages for the patient which may be applicable for reimbursement, of the products and services listed in the claim, are typically provided in the claim to allow insurers to confirm the ordering of the insurance coverages relative to local 'coordination of benefit' rules. One coverage (and only one) with 'focal=true' is to be used in the adjudication of this claim. Coverages appearing before the focal Coverage in the list, and where 'Coverage.subrogation=false', should provide a reference to the ClaimResponse containing the adjudication results of the prior claim.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: Coverage to be used for adjudication
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for adjudication of this claim when set to true.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: A patient may (will) have multiple insurance policies which provide reimbursement for healthcare services and products. For example, a person may also be covered by their spouse's policy and both appear in the list (and may be from the same insurer). This flag will be set to true for only one of the listed policies and that policy will be used for adjudicating this claim. Other claims would be created to request adjudication against the other listed policies.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.
Reference numbers previously provided by the insurer to the provider to be quoted on subsequent claims containing services or products related to the prior authorization.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: This value is an alphanumeric string that may be provided over the phone, via text, via paper, or within a ClaimResponse resource and is not a FHIR Identifier.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Details of a accident which resulted in injuries which required the products and services listed in the claim.
Date of an accident event  related to the products and services contained in the claim.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: The date of the accident has to precede the dates of the products and services but within a reasonable timeframe.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The type or context of the accident event for the purposes of selection of potential insurance coverages and determination of coordination between insurers.

binding.description: Type of accident: work place, auto, etc.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The physical location of the accident event.
A claim line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of details which can also be a simple items or groups of sub-details.
A number to uniquely identify item entries.
Care team members related to this service or product.
Diagnoses applicable for this service or product.
Procedures applicable for this service or product.
Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information applicable for this service or product.
The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

binding.description: Codes for the revenue or cost centers supplying the service and/or products.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.

binding.description: Benefit categories such as: oral, medical, vision, oral-basic etc.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: Billing, service, product, or drug code
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example, in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: Program the product or service is provided under
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example: Neonatal program, child dental program or drug users recovery program.

binding.description: Program specific reason codes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: Date or dates of service or product delivery
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: Place of service or where product was supplied
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

binding.description: Place where the service is rendered.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: Fee, charge or cost per item
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor  = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.
Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc.).
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example: Providing a tooth code, allows an insurer to identify a provider performing a filling on a tooth that was previously removed.

binding.description: The code for the teeth, quadrant, sextant and arch.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A region or surface of the bodySite, e.g. limb region or tooth surface(s).

binding.description: The code for the tooth surface and surface combinations.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: Encounters related to this billed item
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A billed item may include goods or services provided in multiple encounters.
The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

If this item is a group then the values here are a summary of the adjudication of the detail items. If this item is a simple product or service then this is the result of the adjudication of this item.

A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in-aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example, codes indicating: Co-Pay, deductible, eligible, benefit, tax, etc.

binding.description: The adjudication codes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A code supporting the understanding of the adjudication result and explaining variance from expected amount.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example, may indicate that the funds for this benefit type have been exhausted.

binding.description: Adjudication reason codes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Monetary amount associated with the category.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example, amount submitted, eligible amount, co-payment, and benefit payable.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A non-monetary value associated with the category. Mutually exclusive to the amount element above.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example: eligible percentage or co-payment percentage.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Second-tier of goods and services.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.
Categorized monetary totals for the adjudication.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Totals for amounts submitted, co-pays, benefits payable etc.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example, codes indicating: Co-Pay, deductible, eligible, benefit, tax, etc.

binding.description: The adjudication codes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Monetary total amount associated with the category.
Payment details for the adjudication of the claim.
Whether this represents partial or complete payment of the benefits payable.

binding.description: The type (partial, complete) of the payment.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Total amount of all adjustments to this payment included in this transaction which are not related to this claim's adjudication.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Insurers will deduct amounts owing from the provider (adjustment), such as a prior overpayment, from the amount owing to the provider (benefits payable) when payment is made to the provider.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Reason for the payment adjustment.

binding.description: Payment Adjustment reason codes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Estimated date the payment will be issued or the actual issue date of payment.
Benefits payable less any payment adjustment.
Issuer's unique identifier for the payment instrument.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example: EFT number or check number.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A code for the form to be used for printing the content.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: May be needed to identify specific jurisdictional forms.

binding.description: The forms codes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The actual form, by reference or inclusion, for printing the content or an EOB.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Needed to permit insurers to include the actual form.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A note that describes or explains adjudication results in a human readable form.
A number to uniquely identify a note entry.
The business purpose of the note text.

binding.description: The presentation types of notes.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The explanation or description associated with the processing.
A code to define the language used in the text of the note.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Only required if the language is different from the resource language.

binding.description: A human language.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The term of the benefits documented in this response.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Not applicable when use=claim.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Balance by Benefit Category.
Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.

binding.description: Benefit categories such as: oral, medical, vision, oral-basic etc.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: True if the indicated class of service is excluded from the plan, missing or False indicates the product or service is included in the coverage.
A short name or tag for the benefit.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example: MED01, or DENT2.

ExplanationOfBenefit.short: Description of the benefit or services covered
ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: A richer description of the benefit or services covered.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example, 'DENT2 covers 100% of basic, 50% of major but excludes Ortho, Implants and Cosmetic services'.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Is a flag to indicate whether the benefits refer to in-network providers or out-of-network providers.

binding.description: Code to classify in or out of network services.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Indicates if the benefits apply to an individual or to the family.

binding.description: Unit covered/serviced - individual or family.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The term or period of the values such as 'maximum lifetime benefit' or 'maximum annual visits'.

binding.description: Coverage unit - annual, lifetime.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: Benefits Used to date.
Classification of benefit being provided.
ExplanationOfBenefit.comment: For example: deductible, visits, benefit amount.

binding.description: Deductable, visits, co-pay, etc.

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: The quantity of the benefit which is permitted under the coverage.
The quantity of the benefit which have been consumed to date.

FamilyMemberHistory.short: A human identifier for this person
FamilyMemberHistory.definition: Identifier for a person within a particular scope.

FamilyMemberHistory.short: The patient this person is related to
FamilyMemberHistory.definition: The patient this person is related to.

Flag.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this flag by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
Flag.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.
This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.description: Indicates whether this flag is active and needs to be displayed to a user, or whether it is no longer needed or was entered in error.

Flag.definition: Allows a flag to be divided into different categories like clinical, administrative etc. Intended to be used as a means of filtering which flags are displayed to particular user or in a given context.
Flag.comment: The value set will often need to be adjusted based on local business rules and usage context.

binding.description: A general category for flags for filtering/display purposes.

Flag.short: Coded or textual message to display to user
Flag.definition: The coded value or textual component of the flag to display to the user.
Flag.comment: If non-coded, use CodeableConcept.text.  This element should always be included in the narrative.

binding.description: Detail codes identifying specific flagged issues.

Flag.definition: The patient, location, group, organization, or practitioner etc. this is about record this flag is associated with.

Flag.short: Time period when flag is active
Flag.definition: The period of time from the activation of the flag to inactivation of the flag. If the flag is active, the end of the period should be unspecified.
This alert is only relevant during the encounter.
Flag.comment: If both Flag.encounter and Flag.period are valued, then Flag.period.start shall not be before Encounter.period.start and Flag.period.end shall not be after Encounter.period.end.

Flag.definition: The person, organization or device that created the flag.

Goal.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this goal by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
Goal.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

Goal.short: proposed | planned | accepted | active | on-hold | completed | cancelled | entered-in-error | rejected
Goal.definition: The state of the goal throughout its lifecycle.
Goal.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the lifecycleStatus contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.description: Codes that reflect the current state of a goal and whether the goal is still being targeted.

Goal.short: in-progress | improving | worsening | no-change | achieved | sustaining | not-achieved | no-progress | not-attainable
Goal.definition: Describes the progression, or lack thereof, towards the goal against the target.

binding.description: Indicates the progression, or lack thereof, towards the goal against the target.

Goal.definition: Indicates a category the goal falls within.

binding.description: Codes for grouping and sorting goals.

Goal.definition: Identifies the mutually agreed level of importance associated with reaching/sustaining the goal.
Goal.comment: Extensions are available to track priorities as established by each participant (i.e. Priority from the patient's perspective, different practitioners' perspectives, family member's perspectives)  The ordinal extension on Coding can be used to convey a numerically comparable ranking to priority.  (Keep in mind that different coding systems may use a "low value=important".

binding.description: The level of importance associated with a goal.

Goal.definition: Human-readable and/or coded description of a specific desired objective of care, such as "control blood pressure" or "negotiate an obstacle course" or "dance with child at wedding".
Goal.comment: If no code is available, use CodeableConcept.text.

binding.description: Codes providing the details of a particular goal.  This will generally be system or implementation guide-specific.  In many systems, only the text element will be used.

Goal.short: Who this goal is intended for
Goal.definition: Identifies the patient, group or organization for whom the goal is being established.
The date or event after which the goal should begin being pursued.

binding.description: Codes describing events that can trigger the initiation of a goal.

Goal.definition: Indicates what should be done by when.
Goal.comment: When multiple targets are present for a single goal instance, all targets must be met for the overall goal to be met.

Goal.short: The parameter whose value is being tracked
Goal.definition: The parameter whose value is being tracked, e.g. body weight, blood pressure, or hemoglobin A1c level.

binding.description: Codes to identify the value being tracked, e.g. body weight, blood pressure, or hemoglobin A1c level.

Goal.short: The target value to be achieved
Goal.definition: The target value of the focus to be achieved to signify the fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds, 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. When a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or above the low value.
Goal.comment: A CodeableConcept with just a text would be used instead of a string if the field was usually coded, or if the type associated with the Goal.target.measure defines a coded value.

binding.description: Codes to identify the target value of the focus to be achieved to signify the fulfillment of the goal.

Goal.definition: Indicates either the date or the duration after start by which the goal should be met.
Identifies when the current status.  I.e. When initially created, when achieved, when cancelled, etc.
Goal.comment: To see the date for past statuses, query history.

Goal.definition: Captures the reason for the current status.
Goal.comment: This will typically be captured for statuses such as rejected, on-hold or cancelled, but could be present for others.

Goal.definition: Indicates whose goal this is - patient goal, practitioner goal, etc.
Goal.comment: This is the individual responsible for establishing the goal, not necessarily who recorded it.  (For that, use the Provenance resource.).

Goal.definition: The identified conditions and other health record elements that are intended to be addressed by the goal.
Any comments related to the goal.
Goal.comment: May be used for progress notes, concerns or other related information that doesn't actually describe the goal itself.

Goal.short: What result was achieved regarding the goal?
Goal.definition: Identifies the change (or lack of change) at the point when the status of the goal is assessed.
Goal.comment: Note that this should not duplicate the goal status.

binding.description: The result of the goal; e.g. "25% increase in shoulder mobility", "Anxiety reduced to moderate levels".  "15 kg weight loss sustained over 6 months".

Goal.definition: Details of what's changed (or not changed).
Goal.comment: The goal outcome is independent of the outcome of the related activities.  For example, if the Goal is to achieve a target body weight of 150 lb and a care plan activity is defined to diet, then the care plans activity outcome could be calories consumed whereas goal outcome is an observation for the actual body weight measured.

GraphDefinition.short: Canonical identifier for this graph definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
GraphDefinition.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this graph definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this graph definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the graph definition is stored on different servers.
GraphDefinition.comment: Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred.  Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.  The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author.  Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).   In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

GraphDefinition.short: Business version of the graph definition
GraphDefinition.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the graph definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the graph definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
GraphDefinition.comment: There may be different graph definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions.  The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the graph definition with the format [url]|[version].

GraphDefinition.short: Name for this graph definition (computer friendly)
GraphDefinition.definition: A natural language name identifying the graph definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
GraphDefinition.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

GraphDefinition.definition: The status of this graph definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
GraphDefinition.comment: Allows filtering of graph definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

GraphDefinition.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
GraphDefinition.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this graph definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
GraphDefinition.comment: Allows filtering of graph definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

GraphDefinition.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the graph definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the graph definition changes.
GraphDefinition.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the graph definition. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

GraphDefinition.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
GraphDefinition.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the graph definition.
GraphDefinition.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the graph definition is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the graph definition. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the graph definition. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

GraphDefinition.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
GraphDefinition.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

GraphDefinition.short: Natural language description of the graph definition
GraphDefinition.definition: A free text natural language description of the graph definition from a consumer's perspective.
GraphDefinition.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the graph definition was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the graph definition as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the graph definition is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the graph definition was created).

GraphDefinition.short: The context that the content is intended to support
GraphDefinition.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate graph definition instances.
GraphDefinition.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

GraphDefinition.short: Intended jurisdiction for graph definition (if applicable)
GraphDefinition.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the graph definition is intended to be used.
GraphDefinition.comment: It may be possible for the graph definition to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

GraphDefinition.short: Why this graph definition is defined
GraphDefinition.definition: Explanation of why this graph definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
GraphDefinition.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the graph definition. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is.  This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this graph definition.

GraphDefinition.short: Type of resource at which the graph starts
GraphDefinition.definition: The type of FHIR resource at which instances of this graph start.

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

GraphDefinition.definition: The profile that describes the use of the base resource.
GraphDefinition.comment: The code does not include the '$' prefix that is always included in the URL when the operation is invoked.

GraphDefinition.short: Links this graph makes rules about
GraphDefinition.definition: Links this graph makes rules about.

GraphDefinition.short: Path in the resource that contains the link
GraphDefinition.definition: A FHIR expression that identifies one of FHIR References to other resources.
GraphDefinition.comment: The path expression cannot contain a resolve() function. If there is no path, the link is a reverse lookup, using target.params. If the path is "*" then this means all references in the resource.

GraphDefinition.definition: Which slice (if profiled).
Minimum occurrences for this link.
Maximum occurrences for this link.
Information about why this link is of interest in this graph definition.
Potential target for the link.

GraphDefinition.short: Type of resource this link refers to
GraphDefinition.definition: Type of resource this link refers to.

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

GraphDefinition.definition: A set of parameters to look up.
GraphDefinition.comment: At least one of the parameters must have the value {ref} which identifies the focus resource.

GraphDefinition.definition: Profile for the target resource.
Compartment Consistency Rules.
Defines how the compartment rule is used - whether it it is used to test whether resources are subject to the rule, or whether it is a rule that must be followed.
GraphDefinition.comment: All conditional rules are evaluated; if they are true, then the rules are evaluated.

binding.description: Defines how a compartment rule is used.

GraphDefinition.definition: Identifies the compartment.

binding.description: Identifies a compartment.

GraphDefinition.definition: identical | matching | different | no-rule | custom.

binding.description: How a compartment must be linked.

GraphDefinition.short: Custom rule, as a FHIRPath expression
GraphDefinition.definition: Custom rule, as a FHIRPath expression.
Documentation for FHIRPath expression.

Group.definition: A unique business identifier for this group.

Group.short: Whether this group's record is in active use
Group.definition: Indicates whether the record for the group is available for use or is merely being retained for historical purposes.

Group.short: person | animal | practitioner | device | medication | substance
Group.definition: Identifies the broad classification of the kind of resources the group includes.
Group.comment: Group members SHALL be of the appropriate resource type (Patient for person or animal; or Practitioner, Device, Medication or Substance for the other types.).

binding.description: Types of resources that are part of group.

Group.definition: If true, indicates that the resource refers to a specific group of real individuals.  If false, the group defines a set of intended individuals.
Provides a specific type of resource the group includes; e.g. "cow", "syringe", etc.
Group.comment: This would generally be omitted for Person resources.

binding.description: Kind of particular resource; e.g. cow, syringe, lake, etc.

Group.definition: A label assigned to the group for human identification and communication.
A count of the number of resource instances that are part of the group.
Group.comment: Note that the quantity may be less than the number of members if some of the members are not active.

Group.short: Entity that is the custodian of the Group's definition
Group.definition: Entity responsible for defining and maintaining Group characteristics and/or registered members.
Group.comment: This does not strictly align with ownership of a herd or flock, but may suffice to represent that relationship in simple cases. More complex cases will require an extension.

Group.short: Include / Exclude group members by Trait
Group.definition: Identifies traits whose presence r absence is shared by members of the group.
Group.comment: All the identified characteristics must be true for an entity to a member of the group.

Group.definition: A code that identifies the kind of trait being asserted.

binding.description: List of characteristics used to describe group members; e.g. gender, age, owner, location, etc.

Group.definition: The value of the trait that holds (or does not hold - see 'exclude') for members of the group.
Group.comment: For Range, it means members of the group have a value that falls somewhere within the specified range.

binding.description: Value of descriptive member characteristic; e.g. red, male, pneumonia, Caucasian, etc.

Group.definition: If true, indicates the characteristic is one that is NOT held by members of the group.
Group.comment: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications cannot wrongly include excluded members as included or vice versa.

Group.short: Period over which characteristic is tested
Group.definition: The period over which the characteristic is tested; e.g. the patient had an operation during the month of June.

Group.short: Who or what is in group
Group.definition: Identifies the resource instances that are members of the group.
A reference to the entity that is a member of the group. Must be consistent with Group.type. If the entity is another group, then the type must be the same.

Group.short: Period member belonged to the group
Group.definition: The period that the member was in the group, if known.

Group.short: If member is no longer in group
Group.definition: A flag to indicate that the member is no longer in the group, but previously may have been a member.

GuidanceResponse.short: The identifier of the request associated with this response, if any
GuidanceResponse.definition: The identifier of the request associated with this response. If an identifier was given as part of the request, it will be reproduced here to enable the requester to more easily identify the response in a multi-request scenario.
Allows a service to provide  unique, business identifiers for the response.
An identifier, CodeableConcept or canonical reference to the guidance that was requested.

GuidanceResponse.short: success | data-requested | data-required | in-progress | failure | entered-in-error
GuidanceResponse.definition: The status of the response. If the evaluation is completed successfully, the status will indicate success. However, in order to complete the evaluation, the engine may require more information. In this case, the status will be data-required, and the response will contain a description of the additional required information. If the evaluation completed successfully, but the engine determines that a potentially more accurate response could be provided if more data was available, the status will be data-requested, and the response will contain a description of the additional requested information.
GuidanceResponse.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.description: The status of a guidance response.

GuidanceResponse.short: Patient the request was performed for
GuidanceResponse.definition: The patient for which the request was processed.

GuidanceResponse.short: Encounter during which the response was returned
GuidanceResponse.definition: The encounter during which this response was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
GuidanceResponse.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official copmletion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter.

GuidanceResponse.short: When the guidance response was processed
GuidanceResponse.definition: Indicates when the guidance response was processed.
Provides a reference to the device that performed the guidance.
Describes the reason for the guidance response in coded or textual form.

Indicates the reason the request was initiated. This is typically provided as a parameter to the evaluation and echoed by the service, although for some use cases, such as subscription- or event-based scenarios, it may provide an indication of the cause for the response.
Provides a mechanism to communicate additional information about the response.

GuidanceResponse.short: Messages resulting from the evaluation of the artifact or artifacts
GuidanceResponse.definition: Messages resulting from the evaluation of the artifact or artifacts. As part of evaluating the request, the engine may produce informational or warning messages. These messages will be provided by this element.

GuidanceResponse.short: The output parameters of the evaluation, if any
GuidanceResponse.definition: The output parameters of the evaluation, if any. Many modules will result in the return of specific resources such as procedure or communication requests that are returned as part of the operation result. However, modules may define specific outputs that would be returned as the result of the evaluation, and these would be returned in this element.
The actions, if any, produced by the evaluation of the artifact.

If the evaluation could not be completed due to lack of information, or additional information would potentially result in a more accurate response, this element will a description of the data required in order to proceed with the evaluation. A subsequent request to the service should include this data.

HealthcareService.short: External identifiers for this item
HealthcareService.definition: External identifiers for this item.

HealthcareService.short: Whether this HealthcareService record is in active use
HealthcareService.definition: This flag is used to mark the record to not be used. This is not used when a center is closed for maintenance, or for holidays, the notAvailable period is to be used for this.
HealthcareService.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it may be used to mark that the resource was created in error.

HealthcareService.short: Organization that provides this service
HealthcareService.definition: The organization that provides this healthcare service.
HealthcareService.comment: This property is recommended to be the same as the Location's managingOrganization, and if not provided should be interpreted as such. If the Location does not have a managing Organization, then this property should be populated.

HealthcareService.short: Broad category of service being performed or delivered
HealthcareService.definition: Identifies the broad category of service being performed or delivered.
HealthcareService.comment: Selecting a Service Category then determines the list of relevant service types that can be selected in the primary service type.

binding.description: A category of the service(s) that could be provided.

HealthcareService.short: Type of service that may be delivered or performed
HealthcareService.definition: The specific type of service that may be delivered or performed.

binding.description: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty).

HealthcareService.short: Specialties handled by the HealthcareService
HealthcareService.definition: Collection of specialties handled by the service site. This is more of a medical term.
